panelText.text: Facilitation payments are a form of bribery. Bribery is offering, giving, receiving or requesting anything of value with the intention of influencing others in connection with their duties.

Under anti-corruption laws, it is unlawful to pay bribes, and under the U.K. Bribery Act in particular it is unlawful to receive a bribe as well as pay them. Johnson Controls can be held responsible for a bribe paid on our behalf, even if we didn’t know about it.
For a multinational corporation like Johnson Controls, wrongdoing that occurs anywhere exposes our company, our employees and our business partners to law enforcement nearly everywhere.
If you are ever asked for, or offered, anything that could be construed as a bribe, you should immediately exit the conversation and report the request to the Law or Compliance teams.
